div:
If you want to use the application locally only, use Cassini. If you want to expose the application

    on a web server to your team, use IIS.
To install TEAM Mentor on IIS 6:
span: If you want to use the application locally only, use Cassini. If you want to expose the application
on a web server to your team, use IIS.
To install TEAM Mentor on IIS 6:
Download the .zip file of TEAM Mentor and extract it

You can also do a 
Git Clone of the latest version of TEAM Mentor from GitHub (see Install TEAM Mentor from a GitHub Repository)
The
TEAM Mentor root folder should contain the following folders:
Add TEAM Mentor to IIS 6.0. Open the "Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager".
Navigate to "Web Sites" in the tree on the left of the "Internet Information Services (IIS)
Manager" window.
Right-click on "Web Sites" and select "New" -> "Web Site...”
A
"Web Site Creation Wizard" should appear.
Click "Next".
Enter a description for the web
site, something like "TEAM Mentor".
Click "Next".
Change the port setting, if necessary.
Click "Next".
Click "Browse...”
Select to the "Web Applications\TM_Website" folder
inside the TEAM Mentor root folder
Click "Next".
Check
the checkbox next to "Run scripts (such as ASP)".
Click "Next".

Click "Finish". 
A new
web site should appear in the tree structure on the left of the "Internet Information
Services (IIS) Manager" window.
Right-click on this new web site.
Select "Properties". A
"Properties" window should appear.
Go to the "ASP.NET" tab in the "Properties"
window.
Set the .NET version to 4.0. Click "OK".
Right-click on the newly created web site.
Select "Properties". A
"Properties" window should appear.
Click on the Directory Security tab, and hit the Server Certificate button.
Follow the Wizzard to create the CSR
Send the CSR to your Certificate Authority for Signing
Set up Permissions, the account used by IIS needs to have write privileges to the TEAM Mentor Library_Data folder
Identify the application account. which is the Windows user account used by the

IIS Application Pool configured on the TEAM Mentor
 website.
On the "Internet
Information Services (IIS) Manager".
Navigate to "Application Pools" in the tree on the
left.
Right-click on the "Default App Pool" and select "Properties". A "Properties"
window should appear.
Go to the "Identity" tab in the "Properties" window. Take note of
the selected user-name. By default, it is "Network Service".
Adjust the file-system permissions. Give write permissions for the TEAM Mentor Library_Data folder

to the Windows user account that is used
 to run TEAM Mentor. This is the username that
has been discovered in the previous step.
Right click on the TEAM Mentor Library_Data folder
Select "Properties". A "Properties" window
should appear.
Select the "Security" tab in the "Properties" window. Give "Full Access"
permissions to the Windows account that is used to run TEAM Mentor.
Click "OK"
ol:
First generate a CSR
        
          
          
        
        
          
            Right-click on the newly created web site. 
          
          
            Select "Properties". A 
            "Properties" window should appear. 
          
          
            Click on the Directory Security tab, and hit the Server Certificate button.
          
          
            Follow the Wizzard to create the CSR
          
          
            Send the CSR to your Certificate Authority for Signing
          
        
        
          
          
        
        
Install your certificate
        
          Right-Click on the website that the CSR was created on and select Properties. 
          Go to the Directory Security panel. Click on the "Server Certificate..." button. This will start the certificate wizard. Click "Next
          Choose to Process the pending request and install the certificate and click Next.
          "Browse" for your SSL Certificate file received from the Certificate Authority, then Click Next. Follow the rest of the wizard steps until finished.

Set the .NET version to 4.0. Click "OK".
Set up SSL. SSL is enabled by default for TEAM Mentor. Therefore it is necessary to set up SSL certificate. (Note: It is possible to disable SSL configuration see: )

Select "Properties". A 
            "Properties" window should appear.
Click on the Directory Security tab, and hit the Server Certificate button.

Install your certificate

Go to the Directory Security panel. Click on the "Server Certificate..." button. This will start the certificate wizard. Click "Next
Choose to Process the pending request and install the certificate and click Next.
"Browse" for your SSL Certificate file received from the Certificate Authority, then Click Next. Follow the rest of the wizard steps until finished.

Navigate to "Application Pools" in the tree on the 
                left.

Right-click on the "Default App Pool" and select "Properties". A "Properties"

Go to the "Identity" tab in the "Properties" window. Take note of

Select "Properties". A "Properties" window 
                should appear.

Select the "Security" tab in the "Properties" window. Give "Full Access" 
                permissions to the Windows account that is used to run TEAM Mentor.
Click "OK"

a: TEAM Mentor from a GitHub Repository

links.href: /article/Install TEAM Mentor from a GitHub Repository
links.text: TEAM Mentor from a GitHub Repository

html:
If you want to use the application locally only, use Cassini. If you want to expose the application on a web server to your team, use IIS. 

To install TEAM Mentor on IIS 6:

  1. Copy TEAM Mentor files to local folder
    • Download the .zip file of TEAM Mentor and extract it
    • You can also do a Git Clone of the latest version of TEAM Mentor from GitHub (see Install TEAM Mentor from a GitHub Repository)
  2. The  TEAM Mentor root folder should contain the following folders: 
    • Docs
    • Tools
    • Web Applications
    • Library_Data (Note: Only the zip file will have this directory, for TM cloned from GitHub this directory will automatically be created on first run of TM)
  3. Add TEAM Mentor to IIS 6.0. Open the "Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager". 
    • Navigate to "Web Sites" in the tree on the left of the "Internet Information Services (IIS)   Manager" window. 
    • Right-click on "Web Sites" and select "New" -> "Web Site...” 
    • A  "Web Site Creation Wizard" should appear. 
    • Click "Next". 
    • Enter a description for the web  site, something like "TEAM Mentor". 
    • Click "Next". 
    • Change the port setting, if necessary. 
    • Click "Next". 
    • Click "Browse...” 
    • Select to the "Web Applications\TM_Website" folder  inside the TEAM Mentor root folder 
    • Click "Next". 
    • Check  the checkbox next to "Run scripts (such as ASP)". 
    • Click "Next". 
    • Click "Finish".

      A new        web site should appear in the tree structure on the left of the "Internet Information  Services (IIS) Manager" window. 
    • Right-click on this new web site. 
    • Select "Properties". A  "Properties" window should appear. 
    • Go to the "ASP.NET" tab in the "Properties"  window. 
    • Set the .NET version to 4.0. Click "OK".

  4. Set up SSL. SSL is enabled by default for TEAM Mentor. Therefore it is necessary to set up SSL certificate. (Note: It is possible to disable SSL configuration see: )
    1. First generate a CSR
      • Right-click on the newly created web site. 
      • Select "Properties". A  "Properties" window should appear.
      • Click on the Directory Security tab, and hit the Server Certificate button.
      • Follow the Wizzard to create the CSR
      • Send the CSR to your Certificate Authority for Signing
    2. Install your certificate
      • Right-Click on the website that the CSR was created on and select Properties. 
      • Go to the Directory Security panel. Click on the "Server Certificate..." button. This will start the certificate wizard. Click "Next
      • Choose to Process the pending request and install the certificate and click Next.
      • "Browse" for your SSL Certificate file received from the Certificate Authority, then Click Next. Follow the rest of the wizard steps until finished.


  5. Set up Permissions, the account used by IIS needs to have write privileges to the TEAM Mentor Library_Data folder
    • Identify the application account. which is the Windows user account used by the  IIS Application Pool configured on the TEAM Mentor website.
      • On the "Internet  Information Services (IIS) Manager". 
      • Navigate to "Application Pools" in the tree on the  left. 
      • Right-click on the "Default App Pool" and select "Properties". A "Properties"  window should appear. 
      • Go to the "Identity" tab in the "Properties" window. Take note of  the selected user-name. By default, it is "Network Service".
    • Adjust the file-system permissions. Give write permissions for the TEAM Mentor Library_Data folder  to the Windows user account that is used to run TEAM Mentor. This is the username that  has been discovered in the previous step. 
      • Right click on the TEAM Mentor Library_Data folder
      • Select "Properties". A "Properties" window  should appear. 
      • Select the "Security" tab in the "Properties" window. Give "Full Access"  permissions to the Windows account that is used to run TEAM Mentor. 
      • Click "OK"
